VLIB_histogram_nD_U16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_histogram_nD_U16 (const uint16_t *restrict X, const int32_t numX, const int32_t dimX, uint16_t binWeight, const uint16_t *restrict numBins, const uint16_t *restrict normVals, uint16_t *restrict scrap, uint16_t *H1, uint16_t *H)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_histogram_nD_U16 ( const uint16_t *restrict  X,
const int32_t  numX,
const int32_t  dimX,
uint16_t  binWeight,
const uint16_t *restrict  numBins,
const uint16_t *restrict  normVals,
uint16_t *restrict  scrap,
uint16_t *  H1,
uint16_t *  H 
)

Description
Histogram computation for 16-bit vector valued variables of multiple dimensions.
Parameters:
[in] *X Array of input values, data arranged in planar form (UQ16.0)
[in] numX Number of individual vector elements in X (SQ31.0)
[in] dimX Dimensionality of vectors in X (SQ31.0)
[in] binWeight Value to accumulate in histogram bins (UQ16.0)
[in] *numBins Array of size dimX, each element specifies the number of bins required in that dimension (UQ16.0)
[in] *normVals Array of size dimX, each element containing the normalization factor for that dimension (UQ0.16)
[in] *scrap Buffer of size numX, for internal use (UQ16.0)
[in] *H1 Buffer of size equal to total number of bins, for internal use (UQ16.0)
[in,out] *H Array of size equal to total number of bins to hold computed histogram (UQ16.0)
Assumptions
  • The vectors in X should be arranged in planar form (see Example below).
  • H, scrap, and H1 should each be initialized to 0.
  • All buffers should be 8-byte aligned.
  • The normalization factor normVals[k] for each dimension k should be set as in following equation, where M is the maximum value in dimension k, and d > 0:
    • normVals[k] = 1/(M+d)
Example
Assume a 3-dimensional quantity: 
  F = [9 2 3;
       5 3 5;
       8 1 3;
       4 2 3;
       7 1 1];

Where the maximum possible value in each dimension is as follows: 

  Dim 1 = 10
  Dim 2 = 4
  Dim 3 = 5

The required output is a histogram with 3*5*2 bins: 

  Dim 1 = 3 bins
  Dim 2 = 5 bins
  Dim 3 = 2 bins

The following is the form of the input: 

  X = [9 5 8 4 7 2 3 1 2 1 3 5 3 3 1];
  numX = 5;
  dimX = 3;
  binWeight = 1 (or 1/5 for a normalized histogram)
  numBins = [3 5 2];
  normVals = [1/11 1/5 1/6] * 65536;
  scrap = array of 0s of size 5
  H1 = array of 0s of size 30
  H = array of 0s of size 30

Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
